title: Fix bottle_size and pack_count capture in collector
description: Products table has bottle_size=0 and pack_count=0 for all products. Raw MQTT shows correct values (0.5L bottles, 12/16/20/24 packs). Collector not parsing item/bottlesize and item/packcount correctly.
close_reason: Fixed product field capture by tracking per topic path and waiting for all required fields

title: Introspect message formats
description: Analyze sample messages from each topic - identify JSON/binary/text formats, document field types and patterns
close_reason: Closed

title: Design SQLite schema
description: Design database schema based on introspection results - tables for topics, raw messages, and domain-specific data structures
close_reason: Closed

title: Verify WO quantities aggregate across process stages
description: Are total metrics/quantities per process being collected in the work_orders table? Check if we're getting stage-level totals or equipment-level snapshots.
close_reason: Analyzed and documented. work_orders stores SNAPSHOTS (last MQTT value), not aggregates. Aggregated counts are in metrics_10s table. Added analyze_metrics_collection() to analyze_data.py and updated ANALYSIS.md. Run: python analyze_data.py --section metrics

title: Analyze target vs actual quantities
description: What are target/actual quantities for each WO? Calculate completion percentages.
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_target_vs_actual). Doc: ANALYSIS.md section 2.

title: Update explore.py for new schema
description: Update exploration queries to use new schema with reference tables, events, and metrics_10s tables
close_reason: Updated explore.py for v2 schema with reference tables, events, metrics_10s

title: Add MQTT and dotenv dependencies
description: Add paho-mqtt and python-dotenv to pyproject.toml dependencies
close_reason: Closed

title: Determine if counts are incremental or absolute
description: Analyze quantityactual, countinfeed, countoutfeed - are these cumulative totals or incremental deltas?
close_reason: Documented in ANALYSIS.md. CUMULATIVE counts. Script: analyze_workorders.py --lifecycle

title: Investigate early WO closures
description: Are work orders ever closed before meeting target quantity? Analyze WO transitions where final qty < target.
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_early_closures). Finding: Early closures DO occur.

title: Build OEE dashboard/reporting queries
description: Create SQL queries and views for OEE analysis: availability trends, performance by line, downtime breakdown, site comparisons

title: Map active work orders to products and locations
description: How to easily tell what work orders are running, with what products, and where (site/area/line)?
close_reason: Documented in ANALYSIS.md. Script: explore.py --workorders and analyze_workorders.py

title: Analyze work order completion detection
description: How do we know when work orders are complete? What fields/events indicate completion?
close_reason: Documented in ANALYSIS.md. WO change = workorderid change. Script: analyze_workorders.py --completion

title: Add downtime analysis queries
description: Create queries to analyze downtime patterns: planned vs unplanned, by equipment, by time of day, duration distributions

title: Add data retention/archiving policy
description: Define retention periods for metrics_10s, events, and messages_raw. Implement automatic archival or deletion of old data

title: Implement message capture to database
description: Create data_collector.py to continuously capture MQTT messages and store them in SQLite
close_reason: Closed

title: Implement database initialization
description: Create db_init.py with SQLite database setup, table creation, and index definitions
close_reason: Closed

title: Investigate cross-site connections
description: Are there connections between sites? Do work orders/products flow between sites?
close_reason: Documented in ANALYSIS.md. YES cross-site. Script: analyze_workorders.py --crosssite

title: Build exploration queries and document findings
description: Create sample SQL queries for data exploration, build views for simplified access, document discovered data relationships
close_reason: Closed

title: Implement MQTT client connection
description: Create mqtt_client.py with connection handling, auth, and reconnection logic using credentials from .env
close_reason: Closed

title: Add lot transition event logging
description: Log lot transitions to events table when lotnumberid changes. Track prev_lot_id for continuity.

title: Analyze quantity flow across operations
description: Do work orders produce the same quantity across operations? How does quantity change from mixing→filling→packaging? What are the conversion ratios?
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_quantity_flow). Finding: Qty changes due to UOM conversion.

title: Analyze processed work orders
description: What work orders have been processed? List all WOs with their current status.
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_wo_status). Doc: ANALYSIS.md section 1. Run: python analyze_data.py --section wo

title: Link products and lots to work orders
description: What products/lots are on each work order? Show WO-product-lot relationships.
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_wo_products). Finding: Data in MQTT not linked. Bug: proveit2026-tjq

title: MQTT Data Exploration Epic
close_reason: Closed

title: Add time-series trend analysis script
description: Create analyze_trends.py for time-series analysis: quantity progression over hours/days, OEE trends, state duration patterns, production rate analysis.

title: Document WO/product progression through Enterprise B
description: Create comprehensive documentation explaining how work orders and products flow through the manufacturing process from raw materials to finished goods.
close_reason: Doc: PROCESS_FLOW.md - Complete explanation of WO/product flow through mixing→filling→packaging→palletizing

title: Investigate work order capture
description: Work orders table is empty despite MQTT data containing workorder/* topics. May need to adjust topic parsing or field matching in data_collector.py
close_reason: Work orders ARE being captured. 24 in DB. Issue was topic parsing depth which was fixed.

title: Map work order process stage
description: Where are work orders in the process? Map each WO to its current stage (liquidprocessing/fillerproduction/packaging/palletizing).
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_wo_stages). Doc: ANALYSIS.md. Run: python analyze_data.py --section wo

title: Investigate WO quantity overruns
description: Do work orders exceed their target quantities? Find WOs where actual > target and analyze patterns.
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_overruns). Finding: 7+ WOs exceed target, targets are minimums.

title: Analyze multi-operation products and subassemblies
description: Identify multi-operation products vs subassemblies. What is the ordering of operations? How do products flow through the process?
close_reason: Documented in ANALYSIS.md. Process: Mix→Bottle→Pack. Script: analyze_workorders.py --process

title: Link lots to products in collector
description: Currently lots.product_id is always NULL. Need to correlate lot data with product data when they appear on the same equipment/line

title: Add WO transition event logging
description: Currently only state changes logged to events table. Need to also log work order transitions (when workorderid changes) as events with prev_work_order_id.
close_reason: Implemented work_order_completions table to capture WO transitions with final quantities and metrics

description: Subscribe to enterpriseB/# wildcard, capture and log all discovered topics, build topic tree structure
close_reason: Closed

description: Do we have accurate bottle_size and pack_count in products table? Check raw MQTT data for item/bottlesize and item/packcount fields.
close_reason: Script: analyze_data.py (analyze_product_data). Bug filed: proveit2026-1eo for fix.

title: Run collector as background service

description: Analyze WO-Lxx-xxxx-Pxx patterns. What do the segments mean? Line? Sequence? Product variant?
close_reason: Documented in ANALYSIS.md. Pattern: WO-Lxx-xxxx-Pxx. Script: analyze_workorders.py --patterns
